justification: The paper states that “our first step was to test the validity of a ten-item well-being measure … informally referred to as a multidimensional psychological well-being scale,” and later confirms that “all ten items fit into a single factor,” indicating this 10-item MPWB scale is the instrument used to measure psychological well-being.

measured_by: Two-option financial gamble decision-making items (gain/loss frames)
justification: Under Procedure the authors note that “All decision-making items involved choosing between two financial options with risk … varied between gains and losses,” and add that “The use of such items is the predominant method to assess risk-taking in economics and psychology (Dhar and Simonson, 2003).”

measured_by: Standard binary trust item ( ‘Most people can be trusted’ vs ‘Need to be very careful’ )
justification: In the Results section the article reports that “Participants generally rated their trust of others very poorly … in the standard binary items,” and Table 5 lists responses to the binary choice ‘Most people can be trusted’ versus ‘Need to be very careful,’ demonstrating that this single binary item was used to measure general trust.
